marker.comment: On a mooring ball in front of EOS (our cruising friends) house.
Enjoying the area and our cruising friends from EOS.
Today we learned that the sun can shine in R.I. Walked around Newport.
Great 4th celebrations with friends from EOS, Renaissance and Songlines.
Short hop, but actually a great sail to Bristol, RI where we are now anchored.
Enjoying Bristol. Visited the Herreshoff Marine Musem today.
Sailed to Newport where we are now anchored. Friends in the area.
Spent the day aboard with lots of rain, remnants of Cindy.
Enjoyed doint the tourist thing in Newport today - beautiful day!
From Rhode Island to Massachusetts today - anchored at beautiful Cuttihunk.
Anchored at Onset, MA, staged to go through Cape Cod Canal soon.
Warm enough today that Buck got to swim. He is VERY happy!
Zipped through the Cape Cod Canal with >3 knots of current. Now in Plymouth.
Caught a Bluefish while underway to Isles of Shoals, Maine!!!
Whale sighting! Day''s highlight is word of Elizabeth and Eric''s engagement!!
Now in Casco Bay - anchored at Great Chebeague, ME.
Lazy morning and short sail to Cliff Island. Sundowners with Page Hanson!!
Very foggy. Explored Cliff and Eagle Islands. Moving NE today.
Anchored at Harbor Island. Supposedly it''s pretty. We we can''t see it. FOGGY!
Absolutely gorgeous day. Maine is beautiful!! Lots of exploring.
Traveled through gorgeous islands - reminds us of Utah mountain lakes.
On a mooring ball in the quaint lobster town of Frenchboro.
Absolutely gorgeous trip up Somes Sound and now anchored off Squantum Point.
Toured Acadia National Park. Lobster dinner. Sunset on Cadillac Mtn.
Rainy, overcast day. We can''t complain after five absolutely gorgeous days.
Seven mile hike in Acadia National Park today. Beautiful place!
Recovering from our hike yesterday. Walked around Bar Harbor today.
Rented bikes and went 30.6 miles on carriage roads. Whew, we''re tired!
More hiking, beautiful views and great weather. Local neighbors came aboard.
Laundry, groceries, dinner on a friends' boat. Will leave after mail arrives.
Low key, but good day. Heading further northeast soon.
Explored Northeast Harbor today. Rainy day. Mail arrived - leaving soon.
Said our good-byes and had a short sail to just outside Somes Sound.
Explored charming Cranberry Islands today. Another beautiful day.
Long, cold, foggy sail to beautiful and secluded Roque Island archipelago.
Highlights of today were lots of birds, even a Bald Eagle, seals. a deer, sheep.
Short hop to fishing community of Cutler, ME. Canadian islands are in sight!
8+ mile hike along the coast. Spectacular views, mossy forest, blueberries!
Foggy day aboard catching up on misc. chores. Visited a local lighthouse.
Motored into Canada, back to US into Eastport, and now anchcored in South Bay.
Only downside with this remote, gorgeous anchorage is NO cell phone coverage.
Dinghy ride into Eastport where we got some errands done. Another good day.
Exciting day today working on taxes that are due on Monday!
Celebrating: 20 years ago today was the infamous plane ride and our beginning
Saw Puffins at Machias Seal Island. Now at Mistake Island.
Enjoyed Mistake Island area today. No cell phone coverage - FYI
Happy Birthday, Mom and thanks for always following our travels. We love you!
Great sail today and now anchored in Mackeral Cove.
Visited enchanting Buckle Island and toured Swan Island.
Great short sail to charming Isle au Haut where we are now anchored.
Enjoying Isle au Haut after a foggy Sunday.
7+ mile hike today. Such a beautiful spot and a gorgeous day!
Fuel stop on Stonington and then sailed on to Blue Hill Harbor.
Another beautiful spot, in spite of some rain today. Lobster for dinner!
Taxes, laundry, sunshine and hiking made for a good day in Blue Hill.
Visited Wooden Boat School and great sail to BUCK'S HARBOR!!!
Walking tour of historic Belfast - very interesting day.
Short quick sail to Smith's Cove near Castine. Rainy day.
Spitting rain today, but we toured Castine and the Maine Maritime Academy.
Windy, grey Katrina day, but great dinner aboard a neighboring Windjammer!
Sunshine and a great sail today marked the start of our 5th year aboard.
Boisterous sail and now moored in Camden for the Windjammer weekend.
Good morning in Camden and then sailed to Rockland where we are now anchored.
Quiet day in Rockland. Another historical Maine town.
Gorgeous day, gentle sail, now anchored in seclusion in Seal Bay in Vinalhaven.
Another beautiful day and further sail SW, now anchored at Port Clyde.
30 more miles of great sailing and now moored at Five Islands.
Motor sailed up the New Meadows River to the tranquility of The Basin.
Yet another beautiful anchorage...this time up the Quahog Bay at Snow Island.
Anchored for the day at High Head Yacht Club to watch a Navy air show.
Navy air show - now anchored at Harpswell Harbor in Merriconeag Sound.
Moored in Falmouth for a few days visiting with friends.
Toured Portland with a friend. Enjoying the area.
Waiting to head further south after Ophelia remnants are gone.
Waiting in Falmouth to head further south after Ophelia remants are gone.
Waiting in Falmouth to head further south after Ophelia remnants are gone.
Moored in Falmouth, ME. Will head further south after Ophelia has passed.
Heading to Provincetown or beyond overnight.
Somewhat rolly overnight motor to Onset. No wind at all, but full moon!
Very nice beam reach with full moon. Overnight to Onset, Mass.
Anchored temporarily north of the Cape Cod Canal, wating for the tide to change.
Quick ride through the Cape Cod Canal and now anchored in Onset, MA.
Long day with a 64 mile great sail to Block Island, RI.
Three states in three days...MA, RI and now CT, Noank near Mystic.
Nice broad reach overnight to Manhasset, Long Island, NY. Near Hampstead.
Anchored by Port Washington, NY with NYC skyline in the distance.
Train into NYC - very stimulating day. Ground zero is incredible.
Remnants of Rita during the night. Underway today through NYC harbor.
Incredible trip through NYC today and now underway overnight to Cape May, NJ.
Good sail overnight. Now past Cape May, heading further up Delaware Bay.
Anchored in Bohemia River, MD at head of Chesapeake Bay
Short motorsail to Sassafras River after frontal passage.
Anchored near Naval Academy, Annapolis, MD.
Taking off for an overnight sail to Cobbs Creek and our friends KandR
Calm night and making good progress, but unfortunately no wind and motoring.
Arrived safely and had great dinner with Kindle and Rita. All is well.
Great time visiting Kindle and Rita at Chapel Creek, but NO phone coverage!
Enjoying land time with good friends. Will be here until later this week.
Took friends on a day sail today. Still having a great time.
Still having fun, but will leave when the weather improves.
Short hop to Jackson Creek by Deltaville, anchorage with better protection.
Very rainy day aboard as Tammy's remnants pass. Possibly moving on tomorrow.
